item.title: G3: Version 7 of Unfinished Business for Icewind Dale Now Available
item.description:
Like its predecessors for Baldur's Gate and Baldur's Gate II, Unfinished Business for Icewind Dale aims to restore content and quests that were omitted from the game as shipped. The additional content in this mod is based on what I can piece together from various game resources and from talking with former developer JE Sawyer on the Obsidian forums. Version seven features two new components--The High Baptist's Flock and Restored Random Drops--a new German translation, an expansion of the Minor Item Restorations component along with some miscellaneous bugfixes.

item.description:

item.title: TBGCoM: Introduce A New Mod Armin Kasun
item.description:
We are proud to introduce a new mod in the works, Armin Kasun. Armin Kasun is a warrior from north of Amn who offers his services to anyone willing to pay him enough. He does not bother to hide the fact that gold is his primary motivation, but once paid, he claims to be completely loyal as a member. Armin is typically good-natured, able to work (on his part) amiably with most anyone, intelligent, and reserved, though he sometimes may be a bit more friendly towards female characters (employer excepted) than he should be. He will also have the ability to make some items, though certainly not in the bizarre style of Jan. He can be romanced, if the PC tries hard enough, yet doesn't overly annoy him. Armin can be found in Athkatla shortly after you exit Chateau Irenicus.

item.title: Tsuki BG2 OpenBeta released
item.description:
Tsuki BG2 OpenBeta released

In Faerun there are both heroes and villains. Some from the second group want gold. Some want power. Some just one to kill. Tsuki is the worst type: he want pleasure in its every aspect. He wants to be on a winner's side. Is such a man to be trusted? Can you let another Bodhi's servant join you?

Tsuki is a hard-to-stand male diva, with a relationship path to discover by both male and female characters, but if I were you, I wouldn't expect anything romantic. He's not that kind of guy.

item.title: SHS: 1PP High Quality Music for PS:T Released
item.description:
Spellhold Studios

The ever-diligent Erephine has released a new HQ music patch for PS:T alongisde her existing SoA/ToB, TuTu/TotSC and IWD HQ music patches!

This is a patch along with content to allow playback of higher quality, 44.1kHz music in Planescape: Torment. The patch updates all .acm audio in the game, and features several additional tracks by Mark Morgan. The current version of the mod officially supports English 4 disc versions of the game, patched to v1.1 and running Qwinn's fixpack, PS:T Tweaks and PS:T UB (others might work but are untested).

This mod changes the sample rate of .acm files from 22.05kHz to 44.1kHz. It does not affect any .wav or .wavc files present in the game. Install instructions and details included!

item.title: SHS: Adrian NPC Released for SoA & ToB!
item.description:
Rhaella's much-awaited romance mod Adrian has just been released!

"Meet Adrian Sianodel, a 33 year old half-elven mage who, after several recent catastrophes, managed to land a brief but involuntary stint as Irenicus' pet wandmaker. Kill the duergar who guard him, and he'll be quite happy to lend his magic to your cause. To repay the debt, to exact vengeance... and perhaps because he simply has nowhere else to go anymore.

Adrian has lived an interesting life, for lack of a better term, though he's hoping to finally put his past behind him. Aside from his magic, he has a background in espionage and a decadent -- some might say romantic -- streak that has gotten him into trouble in the past. He once pursued (and ultimately wrecked) a political career with one of the most notorious organizations in the Realms, and may very much enjoy the opportunities for intrigue the Shadow Thieves have to offer... if you can drag him away from fighting with the Harper and the Red Wizard long enough to notice, that is.

Adrian may be somewhat difficult to get to know. He is not the most tolerant of people, and while he is intrigued by your powers and heritage (and has far more experience with the machinations of dark gods than he would like), neither his respect nor his trust is particularly easy to earn. That said, he will appreciate a leader willing to take him to task."

item.title: RPGD: Improved Asylum v0.98 Released!
item.description:
RPG Dungeon

Version v0.98 of the Improved Asylum mod has been released! This version of the mod contains somewhat more intensive changes to the mod than previous versions. In particular, the adventuring party that is encountered in the Asylum has been revamped. Not only have the items been reduced in power from their previous status (that resulted in many complaints), but the scripts have also been enhanced to reduce the reliance on uninterupible casting and script-based spell casting. The items used by the adventuring party have also been dramatically reduced in power without affecting the difficulty of the fight. It is my belief that the adventuring party, should you choose to face them, will remain one of the strongest opponents that will faced in Baldur's Gate 2. I do welcome suggestions to improve this fight, however. Players are encouraged to post suggestions on the <a href="http://forums.rpgdungeon.net">RPG Dungeon Forums</a> where they can be seen by Rastor so that he can consider them for further improvements to this mod.

<p>Additionally, this version of the mod includes a fix to the encounter with several drow that occurs on the second level of the Asylum. Previously, a bug could be used to result in the player seeing this fight several times should the player be successful in saving the innocent elven victim. This has been corrected and should result in a more seamless play experience.

<p>Version 0.98 can be obtained from the <a href="http://www.rpgdungeon.net/content/view/33/49/"> RPG Dungeon Download Center</a>. Suggestions or discussions for improvements and technical support can be posted at the <a href="http://forums.rpgdungeon.net/index.php/board,7.0.html">Improved Asylum Forums</a>.

item.title: GemRB 0.7.1 released
item.description:
GemRB is a portable open-source implementation of Bioware's Infinity Engine. It was written to support pseudo-3D role playing games based on the Dungeons & Dragons ruleset (Baldur's Gate and Icewind Dale series, Planescape: Torment).


It has been a good half year since the last release, but we were not slacking off the whole time. While the android SDL2 situation is still unfavourable, the engine continues to mature. This time much of the effort was spent in adding missing iwd2 functionality like feats and subtle rule differences. Besides the usual cohort of bugfixes, this release also brings automatic logging to a GemRB.log file (under GamePath, CachePath, /tmp or none in that order) and a VLC plugin for the few unlucky players with game video in non-MVE/BIK format.

For the details, try GemRB yourself or check the linked changelog for some highlights.

Like its Tutu predecessor, SCS II is mostly a tactics mod, intended to make the combats in the game more challenging and interesting. item.title: Improved Asylum V0.97 Released!
item.description:
RPG Dungeon

Version 0.97 of the Improved Asylum mod has been released! This version is primarily intended as a compatibility upgrade. Older versions of the mod overwrite the Spell Trap file with the version from an older version of Detectable Spells that allows AI scripts to see that the player has the Spell Trap protections up. This is a holdover from much earlier and less sophisticated ways of modding BG2. This caused a problem if Improved Asylum was installed after another mod that changed the Spell Trap spell. This problem has been corrected. The new version has been changed to include the version of Detectable Spells that comes with the Sword Coast Stratagems 2 mod for Baldur's Gate 2.

Thanks to DavidW for the code for the new Detectable Spells!

For now, only the PC version of the mod is available. A Mac OSX version will be following over the next several days.

item.title: SHS Welcomes Adrian!
item.description:
Spellhold Studios

SHS is proud to welcome Rhaella and her NPC, Adrian, to the fold!

Meet Adrian Sianodel, a 33 year old half-elven mage who, after several recent catastrophes, managed to land a brief but involuntary stint as Irenicus' pet wandmaker. Kill the duergar who guard him, and he'll be quite happy to lend his magic to your cause. To repay the debt, to exact vengeance... and perhaps because he simply has nowhere else to go anymore.

Adrian has lived an interesting life, for lack of a better term, though he's hoping to finally put his past behind him. Aside from his magic, he has a background in espionage and a decadent -- some might say romantic -- streak that has gotten him into trouble in the past. He once pursued (and ultimately wrecked) a political career with one of the most notorious organizations in the Realms, and may very much enjoy the opportunities for intrigue the Shadow Thieves have to offer... if you can drag him away from fighting with the Harper and the Red Wizard long enough to notice, that is.

Adrian may be somewhat difficult to get to know. He is not the most tolerant of people, and while he is intrigued by your powers and heritage (and has far more experience with the machinations of dark gods than he would like), neither his respect nor his trust is particularly easy to earn. That said, he will appreciate a leader willing to take him to task.

Adrian features:
  • A colourful new sorcerer NPC
  • Banters with the original Bioware NPCs
  • Interjections and other commentary
  • A new quest
  • A romance for an eligible female protagonist
  • A friendship path for a protagonist not romancing him
  • Player initiated dialogue and flirts
  • Crossmod with many NPCS
  • Original portrait by MiLeah
